alert.note: Alert for Jones (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 11:44AM EDT until September 02 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Trent River At West of Trenton affecting Jones County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trent River At West of Trenton. * WHEN...From Friday morning to late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Some homes near the river near Free Bridge Road are threatened. At 14.0 feet, Farmland and fields are flooded along the river. Water inundates the Trent River Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 2.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning to a crest of 14.6 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 07/16/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 245 AM EDT.
